questions.question: Which of the following is not a typical way for a person to catch a disease?

choices.answer: From pathogens in boiled water
From pathogens in the air
From pathogens in poorly cooked food
From physical contact with an infected person

questions.question: A pathogen can come in the form of:

choices.answer: a virus
a bacteria
a protozoa or fungi
all of these

questions.question: You are investigating the cause of a mysterious disease. Which of the following would not be important to determine?

choices.answer: Who the diseased people were in contact with recently
Where the diseased people had recently been.
The food that the diseased people recently ate.
How wealthy the diseased people were.

questions.question: Where would a disease transmitted by person-to-person contact be most likely to spread quickly?

choices.answer: In a crowded city.
In a rural farming community, where neighbors live miles apart.
In a remote region, where contact between people is rare.
In a medical lab, where people wear protective gear and equipment is clean.

questions.question: What type of disease transmission is most likely represented by the graph shown below?

choices.answer: Person to person.
Foodborne.
Airborne.
Foodborne and airborne.

questions.question: Which of the following patterns is most likely to indicate a foodborne illness?

choices.answer: All of the victims worked in the same office.
All of the victims were friends.
All of the victims shopped at the same supermarket.
All of the victims had the same symptoms.
